title: Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper learn US Open fate as epic matches await Brits
description: Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper will fly the British flag at the US Open.
content:
Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper will fly the British flag at the US Open

Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper have been handed exciting paths at the US Open, with the draw taking place on Thursday. The two players will fly the flag for Great Britain in the final Grand Slam tournament of the year. They have been handed simple starts on paper, with the pair set to face qualifiers or lucky losers in their opening matches.

In the event Raducanu finds some form and gets through the first two rounds, she could face Elena Rybakina in round three. She will be hoping to mount a deep run at the tournament she won against all odds back in 2021. It will be her first Grand Slam under the watchful eye of Francisco Roig, her new coach who previously worked with Rafael Nadal.

Draper, meanwhile, could go up against Jannik Sinner in the quarter-finals if he makes it through to the last eight. Sinner is currently battling illness but his coach Darren Cahill has insisted that he will be 'fine' for the US Open.

We'll be bringing you the very latest updates, pictures, and video on this breaking news story.

Stay up to date with all the big headlines, pictures, analysis, opinion and video on the stories that matter to you.

We're also on Facebook @DailyExpressSport - offering your must-see news, features, videos, and pictures throughout the day to like, comment, and share from the Daily Express, Sunday Express, and Express.co.uk.
summary: British tennis players Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper have been handed exciting paths at the US Open, where they will represent Great Britain in the final Grand Slam tournament of the year. The pair are expected to face qualifiers or lucky losers in their opening matches. If they find form, they could potentially face Elena Rybakina in round three. This will be Raducanus' first Grand Slam under the watchful eye of Francisco Roig, who previously worked with Rafael Nadal. If Draper is through to the quarter-finals, he could face Jannishly J.
shortSummary: Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper will represent Great Britain in their opening matches at the US Open, with potential for future clashes.
argos_summary: Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper are set to represent Great Britain at the US Open, with their draws featuring easy first‑round matches against qualifiers or lucky losers. Raducanu could face Elena Rybakina in round three if she wins her first two matches, while Draper might meet Jannik Sinner in the quarter‑finals if Sinner advances. The article notes Raducanu’s new coach Francisco Roig and Sinner’s illness concerns, and promises updates and coverage of the tournament.
